column5: Read on several media outlets of the drought Canada is facing. Seems they planned for heavy rains across the nation and <2% has seen any rain. Now it is just a trickle vs the flow promised from the rain gods where they are now saying most of Canada will see rain by September. Although they said there were a lot of clouds in their skies, the clouds are not delivering rain and now they plan to domesticate a cloud in Montreal that wonâ€™t happen until late fall. Seems it will be another bad drought and little rain for Canada this year ago and hopefully those depending on the rain can survive again.

Like I said before, crossing the hedge won't be possible till we all receive some rain, and September seems to be the prediction. Of course miracle storms might happen so I'm leaving August alone as a buffer.
Jokes aside, there does appear to be a drought and unless we have a snowy end of winter/lots of rain in the spring lakes/rivers are going to be low. Might not bode well for the spring spawn
I wish the Dept of Agriculture would tell the rain-starved exactly how much rain is needed to ensure safe harvest
I think you mean record yield harvest !
Icbm in montana getting ready to go on alert status, hope those 50 ton doors don't slide open
